gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD
Class ImageViewComponent

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.ImageViewComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewComponent, IAxisAddible, ILogAxisAddible, IMarkerAddible, IOverlayAddible, IZoomAddible, IZoomTextAddible, IViewComponent2D, IColorScaleAddible, java.io.Serializable
public class ImageViewComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements IViewComponent2D, IColorScaleAddible, IZoomTextAddible, IMarkerAddible, IPreserveState, java.io.Serializable

This class allows the user to view data in the form of an image. Meaning is given to the data by way of overlays, which add calibration, selection, and annotation abilities.

The ImageViewComponent uses a series of coordinate systems. The only coordinate system visible to programmers is the "World Coordinate" system, which is the range of x-axis and y-axis values that can be found in the AxisInfo class of each axis.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

PRECISION

public static final java.lang.String PRECISION
"Precision" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the precision this view component will have. Precision affects the significant digits displayed on the Axis Overlay, among other things. The value that this key references is a primative integer, with value > 0.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FONT

public static final java.lang.String FONT
"Font" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the font used by this view component. This font will also be passed on to overlays, such as the Axis, Annotation, and Selection. The value that this key references is of type Font.

See Also:

COLOR_CONTROL

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

addMarker

public void addMarker(Marker mark)
Add a marker to be displayed on the image. The marker is best used for programmatic highlighting, such as peaks. Use annotations to write text or interactively mark. Remember, marks of the same type, color, and size can be grouped into one marker.

Specified by:
addMarker in interface IMarkerAddible
Parameters:
mark - The marker or list of markers with the same attributes that will be displayed on the image.

removeMarker

public void removeMarker(Marker mark)
Remove mark from the list of markers, causing it to no longer appear on the image. Any marker that is removed will only appear on the image if it is re-added using addMarker().

Specified by:
removeMarker in interface IMarkerAddible
Parameters:
mark - The marker to be removed.

removeAllMarkers

public void removeAllMarkers()
Remove all markers from the MarkerOverlay, causing no markers to appear on the image. Any marker that is removed will only appear on the image if it is re-added using addMarker().

Specified by:
removeAllMarkers in interface IMarkerAddible

preserveAspectRatio

public void preserveAspectRatio(boolean doPreserve)
Call this method to prevent the center image from being distorted. If true, the zoomed image will resize to the aspect ratio of the image rows and columns.

Parameters:
doPreserve - If true, the image will not be distorted.

getAxisInformation

public AxisInfo getAxisInformation(int axiscode)
This method returns the info about the specified axis. Currently, axes for the image can only be viewed in linear form. If log axes are required, FunctionViewComponent does this and may provide code to implement this.

Specified by:
getAxisInformation in interface IAxisAddible
Parameters:
axiscode - Use AxisInfo integer codes.
Returns:
If axiscode = AxisInfo.X_AXIS, return info about x axis. If axiscode = AxisInfo.Y_AXIS, return info about y axis. If axiscode = AxisInfo.Z_AXIS, return info about "value" axis.

getPrecision

public int getPrecision()
This method will return the precision specified by the user. Precision will be assumed to be 4 if not specified. The overlays will call this method to determine the precision.

setPointedAt

public void setPointedAt(floatPoint2D fpt)
This method sets the pointed-at position and adjusts the crosshairs on the image. setPointedAt() can be called from the viewer to synchronize the pointed-at of this component with the pointed-at of another component.

Specified by:
setPointedAt in interface IViewComponent2D
Parameters:
fpt - The current pointed-at floatPoint2D in world coordinates.

getPointedAt

public floatPoint2D getPointedAt()
This method gets the current pointed-at position in world coordinates. The current pointed-at position is point on the image where the crosshairs intersect. getPointedAt() can be called from the viewer to synchronize the pointed-at of this component with the pointed-at of another component.

Specified by:
getPointedAt in interface IViewComponent2D
Returns:
The current pointed-at floatPoint2D in world coordinate.

addSelectedRegion

public void addSelectedRegion(Region world_coord_region)
This method allows users to add a selection without removing previous selections.

Parameters:
world_coord_region - The array of regions to be added, with defining points in world coord points.
See Also:
SelectionOverlay

setSelectedRegions

public void setSelectedRegions(Region[] rgn)
This method creates a selected region to be displayed over the imagejpanel by the selection overlay. Any previously selected regions will be erased by using this method. To maintain previous selections, use addSelectedRegion(). A stack could be added to allow for undo and redo of selections. If null is passed as a parameter, the selections will be cleared.

Specified by:
setSelectedRegions in interface IViewComponent2D
Parameters:
rgn - - array of selected Regions

getSelectedRegions

Specified by:
getSelectedRegions in interface IViewComponent2D
Returns:
selectedregions

getControls

public ViewControl[] getControls()
Returns all of the controls needed by this view component. Controls are as follows:

[0] = Intensity Slider
[1] = Color Scale, No calibrations
[2] = Cursor Readout
[3] = Marker Overlay Control
[4] = Axis Overlay Control
[5] = Selection Overlay Control
[6] = Annotation Overlay Control
[7] = Pan View Control

Specified by:
getControls in interface IViewComponent
Returns:
controls

getMenuItems

public ViewMenuItem[] getMenuItems()
Returns all of the menu items needed by this view component

Specified by:
getMenuItems in interface IViewComponent
Returns:
menus;

Specified by:
getDisplayPanel in interface IViewComponent
Returns:
JPanel containing imagejpanel in the center of a borderlayout.

kill

public void kill()
This method is called by the viewer to inform the view component it is no longer needed. In turn, the view component closes all windows created by it before closing.

Specified by:
kill in interface IViewComponent

setColorControlEast

public void setColorControlEast(boolean isOn)
This method allows the user to place a VERTICAL color control in the east panel of the view component. If this method is called, it is assumed that the simple color scale in the controls is no longer wanted, so that color scale will disappear.

Parameters:
isOn - - true if calibrated color scale appears to the right of the image.

setColorControlSouth

public void setColorControlSouth(boolean isOn)
This method allows the user to place a HORIZONTAL color control in the south panel of the view component. If this method is called, it is assumed that the simple color scale in the controls is no longer wanted, so that color scale will disappear.

Parameters:
isOn - - true if calibrated color scale appears below the image.

getColumnRowAtPixel

public java.awt.Point getColumnRowAtPixel(java.awt.Point pixel_pt)
Get the (x = column, y = row) "image coordinate" point of the image at the "pixel coordinate" point given. This method will map pixel values to image column/row values.

Parameters:
pixel_pt - The pixel value (x=row,y=column) of the image.
Returns:
The "Image Coordinate" value of pixel_pt.

getColumnRowAtWorldCoords

public java.awt.Point getColumnRowAtWorldCoords(floatPoint2D wc_pt)
Get the (x = column, y = row) "image coordinate" point of the image at the "world coordinate" point given. This method will map world coordinate values (defined by AxisInfo) to image column/row values.

Parameters:
wc_pt - The world coordinate value (x-axis,y-axis) of the image.
Returns:
The "Image Coordinate" value of wc_pt.

getWorldCoordsAtPixel

public floatPoint2D getWorldCoordsAtPixel(java.awt.Point pixel_pt)
Get the (x-axis, y-axis) "world coordinate" point of the image at the "pixel coordinate" point given. This method will map pixel values to world coordinate x-axis/y-axis values.

Parameters:
pixel_pt - The pixel value (x=row,y=column) of the image.
Returns:
The "World Coordinate" value of pixel_pt.

getWorldCoordsAtColumnRow

public floatPoint2D getWorldCoordsAtColumnRow(java.awt.Point col_row_pt)
Get the (x-axis,y-axis) "world coordinate" value of the (x = column, y = row) "image coordinate" point given. This method will map image column/row values to world coordinate values (defined by AxisInfo).

Parameters:
col_row_pt - The image coordinate value (column,row) of the image.
Returns:
The "World Coordinate" point of col_row_pt.

returnFocus

public void returnFocus()
This method is will give focus to the correct overlay so that keyboard events are recognized after controls are given focus.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
